title: Hospitals: New collective agreement expands access to overtime
title_national_language: Avtale om utvidede rammer for overtidsarbeid i sykehus i forbindelse med koronavirusepidemien
status_of_regulation: New aspects included into existing measure
category: Ensuring business continuity and support for essential services
subcategory: Change of work arrangements (working time, rota schemes)
background_info_description: To facilitate the adaption to crisis management during the COVID-19 crisis, the Employers’ Association Spekter and the central organisations in the hospital sector (Unio, LO Stat, Akademikerne and YS Stat ) on 15 March made an agreement on working time. The measures were introduced to make it possible on short notice to increase staffing in hospitals and other associated institutions, and, for infection control reasons, to reduce the number of shifts and unnecessary movement of staff between different wards.
content_of_measure_description: On 15 March, the Employers’ Association Spekter and the central organisations in the hospital sector (Unio, LO Stat, Akademikerne and YS Stat) made an agreement on working time. The agreement was made pursuant to section 10-12 (4) in the Working Environment Act that gives larger trade unions right to enter into a collective agreement that deviates from the law's working hours provisions. The collective agreement expanded the limits to overtime (from 10 to 20 hours per 7 days), and gave the employer the opportunity to averaging working hours. The limit of total working hours in any 24-hour period were raised from 10 to 16 hours. According to the agreement, employers are obliged to discuss the use of overtime with shop stewards before overtime work under the agreement is implemented. The agreement states that overtime cannot be imposed pursuant to the agreement when the extraordinary situation associated with coronavirus no longer exists. The validity period of the agreement was originally 26 weeks, and the agreement could be terminated with two month's notice from each of the parties.
involvement_of_social_partners_descripti: The collective agreement on working time during the COVID-19 pandemic was negotiated by the parties, the Employers’ Association Spekter and the central organisations in the hospital sector (Unio, LO Stat, Akademikerne and YS Stat), on initiative from the state and the social partners jointly, to facilitate crisis management. By taking such action, the social partners wanted to keep regulation of working time in a collective agreement and avoid state intervention.
